intro: Schradera suaveolens, commonly known as sweet schradera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Schradera suaveolens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and fragrance.
